revised_title: Investigations on the Reversal of Metallic Vapour Lines
tldr: The authors investigate the reversal of lines in metallic vapours, specifically caesium and rubidium, by heating their chlorides with sodium in glass tubes. They observe that the vapours of these metals are extremely opaque to the light of the refrangibility absorbed, and that the reversal of these lines occurs almost as readily as that of the D lines by sodium.
